Posts.EditableText:
Your game got lost? Ha! The amount of times I've heard that.

"I was just about to release my epic masterpiece that will redefine the way computer games are played for the next fifty years... but then my computer crashed and I lost it."

Strange that people who can create such masterpieces have never heard of backing up their work.

Posts.HTML:
1. never said it was a masterpeice
2. did i not mention the words BACKUP DRIVE
3. what does it have to do with you whether i make a game or not anyway?

Posts.EditableText: Your backup drive is your Floppy or CD/DVD-R/RW drive, you use removable media because drive's do fail, but it is a lot less likely that properly stored/handled media will fail.
Posts.HTML: Your backup drive is your Floppy or CD/DVD-R/RW drive, you use removable media because drive's do fail, but it is a lot less likely that properly stored/handled media will fail.
